alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 3:34AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT ABOVE 500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning above 2000 feet, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 22 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Cascade mountains Snohomish and King Counties, including Stevens Pass and Snoqualmie Pass. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes
